description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fd1cu","text":"Purpose and Scope of the Procedure","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ehthh","text":"Standardize process for processing lung donations into components for storage and distribution","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"846p3","text":"Scope:       coordination of receipt and gross dissection of tissue","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: NIH Senescence Network Consortium “TriState SenNet Lung and Heart Tissue Mapping Consortium”

groups.title: Cellular Senescence Network (SenNet) Method Development Community

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"csuiq","text":"Scientific Principles ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"31fld","text":"Rapid, standardized and safe processing of human tissue for the HTC requires coordination of a team of staff, materials and attention to protocols","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4v9tf","text":"Rapid processing is required to maintain the tissues in a state as close to normal as possible","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3mgq8","text":"Ultra-High Resolution CT Scan in an inflated state will provide a high-level comparative assessment of human lung structure across developmental ages","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

related_materials.name: 20% Paraformaldehyde (PFA); Diluted to 4% (m/v) PFA in 1X PBS
10X PBS; Diluted to 1X with DEPC H2O

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bkr7o","text":"Assemble Team and Materials as needed for processing, to accomplish:","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":68}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"85rv3","text":"    i.CT Scan","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2k4kc","text":"    ii.Separation of Lobes","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ao47u","text":"    iii.Tissue Dissociation","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8tkli","text":"    iv.Formalin Inflation","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ejs37","text":"    v.OCT /CMC Inflation","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bkb5g","text":"    vi.Paraformaldehyde Inflation","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fj7sp","text":"Record details of procedures in Worksheets. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6drng","text":"Shipped package is opened on arrival to remove a blood sample, if provided, as it should be kept at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ecjnf","text":" The remainder of the package is to be kept in cold room until processing begins to maintain approximately   temperature of tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":107,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"b26es","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"65D98D50D00D11EAB947256F458EA52C","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bui75","text":"Determine BRINDL PID to assign to tissues and images by clicking the “arrived” button in BRINDL Screening log","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cheh5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ltmn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"oo7l","text":"Record Information on Shipping Labels in Database or worksheet for entry ASAP","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1i87j","text":"    i.UNOS #; Referring Company #","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b3cle","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5mvi2","text":"    ii.Courier and Tracking Numbers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c5ch","text":"Remove Shipping Labels from package; place aside to be added to Sample File","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3rbs1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"41i9h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"do5bd","text":"Open Shipping Box and Remove Styrofoam Cover","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b5cv5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8oae4","text":"i.Note Condition of Packing in Database (ice sufficient, layered packaging, no leakage, etc.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ffgja","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6b95j","text":"6.Open container containing tissue and move lung tissue to a clean plastic bag on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"u79d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4vv37","text":"    i.Note Condition of Lung Tissue in Database","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6tiuc","text":"        a.Is tissue submerged (usually in plastic bag, inside a hard plastic container)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3v2i7","text":"        b.Are Trachea and both lungs included and intact","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ftjml","text":"        c.Is Trachea Occluded, if so how","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8oql","text":"        d.Are Thymus, Spleen, Blood Sample, Lymph Nodes included?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fide0","text":"Maintain tissues in transplant buffer on ice. Prevent open Trachea from being submerged , +/- ETT removal","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f2f6s","text":"Weigh intact organ as sent; Continue to Record all measurements and procedures in Worksheet or directly in BRINDL database                                              ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5of9q","text":"Determine displacement volume without inflation                                              ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eeth1","text":"Determine plan for organ lobes ie which to be inflated or infused and which to be dissociated                                              ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ah1cg","text":"Remove excess tissues around trachea and large airways at hilum  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dfta1","text":"    Collect lymph nodes, excess large vessels, esophagus and nerves ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ddlm5","text":"        (Best to place these back in storage buffer and Tend to Lung First)  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5bk94","text":"        a.     Weigh each tissue collected  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5i8fh","text":"        b.     The non-lung samples are sectioned into approximately 0.5-1 cm3 portions  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1ins8","text":"        c.     Divide these tissues between                                                                                                      ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7n82v","text":"             i.    10% formalin, place in labeled tissue cassette in formalin","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4u6su","text":"                    Store at   to fix for 44-48 hrs, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"bqg3u","text":"                    Section at mid-time.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9chkn","text":"                    Volume of fixative to tissue should be approximately 10:1.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7aiuj","text":"            ii.     PFA: place in 4%PFA stored at   to fix for 20-28 hours before moving to 30%Sucrose  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"6udj4","text":"        d.     Record these tissues and how processed in BRINDL database  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"B5E72520D01011EAB947256F458EA52C","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"375B6760D01111EAB947256F458EA52C","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bqmvf","text":" Dissect free the bronchial branches, identify pulmonary arteries and veins   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6sb63","text":"Divide airways and vessels to obtain 5 independent lung lobes  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"95f75","text":"Weigh each lobe once isolated ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6lep","text":"Proceed with processing for each lobe as using appropriate Protocols","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9oapv","text":"Prepare accompanying tissue such as thymus, spleen, esophagus, blood, heart, in similar fashion with specific as outlined in the appropriate Protocol / SOP.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

title: 603.3 & 604.5_URMC_HTC_Lung and Lobe Processing for SenNet
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"9lbp5","text":"Personnel will adhere to safe work processes outlined in U.S. Public Health Universal Precautions Guidelines for use of human blood and body fluids. PPE will be used including lab coat, closed shoes and gloves. All activity will be behind shield of biosafety cabinet and/or a grossing station with mask and safety glasses. Biosafety level 2 practices will be followed and the work performed in the designated lab space that is covered by annually updated IBC approved protocol.All institutional biosafety measures are followed in any manipulation of these human tissues.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
